content: sweeper cardi by tiffany roots craftination wordpress com materials about 2 oz of any worsted weight 100% cotton yarn in any color have fun use scraps in many different colors used in photo lily sugar n cream in delft blue j 6 00 mm hook tapestry needle button special stitch fpsc front post single_crochet insert hook from the front around the post of the double_crochet in the row below if you are left handed you will insert your hook from the left to right around the post if you are right handed you will insert your hook from the right to left around the post finish your single_crochet as you would normally abbreviations chain s chain s double_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch fpsc front post single_crochet space space single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet this work is licensed under the creative commons attribution-noncommercial-share alike 3 0 united states license sweeper cardi by tiffany roots craftination wordpress com finished size my swiffer measures 10 x 4 if you have a newer or older model you can decrease or increase in multiples of three just make sure to keep track of proper placement of the pfsc pattern in order to keep the wave stitch look pattern row 1 chain 35 work double_crochet into the 4nd chain from the hook double_crochet in each chain across row 2 turn chain 1 fpsc around the first 3 double_crochet 1 double_crochet in next 3 double_crochet 1 fpsc in next 3 double_crochet repeat to end row 3 turn chain 3 counts as first double_crochet skip first fpsc double_crochet in next 2 fpsc 1 double_crochet in next 3 double_crochet 1 double_crochet in next 3 fpsc repeat to end row 4 turn chain 3 counts as first double_crochet skip first double_crochet double_crochet in next 2 double_crochet 1 fpsc in next 3 double_crochet 1 double_crochet in next 3 double_crochet repeat to end row 5 turn chain 3 counts as first double_crochet skip first double_crochet double_crochet in next 2 double_crochet 1 double_crochet in next 3 fpsc 1 double_crochet in next 3 double_crochet repeat to end row 6 - 9 repeat row 2 5 once optional row 10 turn single_crochet around edges spacing stitches evenly across each side working 3 single_crochet into each corner row 11 join to first single_crochet with slip_stitch chain 2 half_double_crochet across to last single_crochet before corner single_crochet begins if you have skipped row 10 your row 11 will read turn chain 2 half_double_crochet across in each double_crochet row 12 turn chain 2 counts as first half_double_crochet half_double_crochet across to end working last half_double_crochet into chain 2 of last row row 13 - 14 repeat row 12 twice row 15 turn chain 2 counts as first half_double_crochet half_double_crochet in next 12 half_double_crochet 13 half_double_crochet made row 16 turn chain 2 half_double_crochet across row 17 - 20 repeat row 16 four times row 21 turn slip_stitch to opposite edge of swiffer to appropriate 13 stitches fasten off this work is licensed under the creative commons attribution-noncommercial-share alike 3 0 united states license
